page.title: 08GEOGRAPHY OF SEAMILL (2)
page.content: { {Hunterston via Portencross. { {Portencross}is a very rocky part of the coast. It has a castle and an old, dangerous pier. The pier has a large hole in the middle. Beside the castle is an old cannon from a{Spanish {Galleon.}The galleon lies deep in the sea, just out from Portencross.In years gone by Scottish kings lay in rest at Portencross Castle before being carried by boat to the Isle of Iona for burial. From Seamill to Portencross most of the land is owned by the{West Kilbride {Golf Club.}This is a good course with a nice clean clubhouse.
